snippet: U.S. citizens may fear homegrown jihadists, but law enforcement is more worried about right-wing extremists.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Charles Kurzman and David Schanzer warns that greatest terrorist threat within United States is right-wing extremism, not American Muslims radicalized by overseas extremists; cautions that public debates on terrorism have inordinate focus on Muslims, which not only does them disservice but also clouds fact that right-wing, anti-government militants pose greater threat.

byline.original: By CHARLES KURZMAN and DAVID SCHANZER

lead_paragraph: U.S. citizens may fear homegrown jihadists, but law enforcement is more worried about right-wing extremists.
